me.tatarka.ipromise

Class Task<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.tatarka.ipromise.Task<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the result type
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CancelableTask

    public class Task<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    An easy way to start run something asynchronously and return a Promise.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  Task.Do<T>
      The callback for the task to execute
      static class  Task.DoFailable<T,E extends java.lang.Exception>
      If your callback may throw an exception, you can use this to automatically, catch the exception and return a Result.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected Task.Do<T> callback 
      protected CancelToken cancelToken 
      protected Deferred<T> deferred 
      protected java.util.concurrent.Executor executor 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Task(java.util.concurrent.Executor executor, Task.Do<T> callback)
      Constructs a new Task with the given callback that will be run by the given Executor when start() is called.
      Task(Task.Do<T> callback)
      Constructs a new Task with the given callback that will be run in a separate thread when start() is called.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      static <T> Promise<T> run(Task.Do<T> callback)
      Runs the callback in a separate thread, delivering the result in the returned Promise.
      Promise<T> start()
      Start executing the callback for this Task.

      • Task

        public Task(java.util.concurrent.Executor executor,
            Task.Do<T> callback)
        Constructs a new Task with the given callback that will be run by the given Executor when start() is called.
        Parameters:
        executor - the executor to use to run the callback.
        callback - the callback

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public static <T> Promise<T> run(Task.Do<T> callback)
        Runs the callback in a separate thread, delivering the result in the returned Promise. This is equivalent to: new Task(callback).start().
        Type Parameters:
        T - the result type
        Parameters:
        callback - the callback to run in a separate thread.
        Returns:
        the promise that will deliver the result

      • run

        public static <T> Promise<T> run(java.util.concurrent.Executor executor,
                                 Task.Do<T> callback)
        Runs the callback with the given Executor, delivering the result in the returned Promise. This is equivalent to: new Task(executor, callback).start().
        Type Parameters:
        T - the result type
        Parameters:
        executor - the executor to use to run the callback.
        callback - the callback
        Returns:
        the promise that will deliver the result

      • promise

        public Promise<T> promise()
        Returns the promise for this Task.
        Returns:
        the promise

      • start

        public Promise<T> start()
        Start executing the callback for this Task.
        Returns:
        the promise
